quotes: getting a job, getting jobs. Because, people didn't wanna hire a felon.
they didn't wanna hire you in, that's one of the things I didn't like about the job.
explanation: The quote suggests that successful reintegration after prison requires changes in hiring practices, as individuals struggle to find employment due to their criminal record.

quotes: But the little that I learned from them at that time, it helped me.
you learn a lot of things which you can use it for, for good to assist you in elevating yourself
explanation: The quote suggests that building technological literacy can lead to better hiring practices as it increases the employability of the individual.

quotes: and that plays into your it plays into your mental, because you already struggling out here
we need help dealing with this stuff because mental health is very, very important when dealing with ex prisoners
explanation: The quote suggests that mental health resources are required to support post-prison reintegration as individuals struggle with mental health issues when transitioning to a life after prison.

quotes: I found out that a lot of organizations in the years I've been out, they do a lot of talk.
We need to get the groups together that's doing the work.
explanation: The quote suggests that promoting societal issue awareness supports changes in hiring practices as more people become aware of the struggles faced by prisoners in job searching.

quotes: people need to know about how to get credit.
you'll find yourself. And a lot of debt
explanation: The quote suggests that maintaining good credit is required for successful reintegration after prison as financial struggles can hinder the reintegration process.

quotes: Live a crime free life. Live a life that you can be helpful to someone in some way.
if you're saying you're gonna take some money, then you should put the money in education.
explanation: The quote suggests that promoting equality in education supports encouraging active citizenship as education enables individuals to live a crime-free life and contribute to society.
